intro: Secale cereale var. perennans, commonly known as the perennial rye grass, is a variant of rye that exhibits perennial growth habits. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and grass-like leaves, which are typically narrow and slightly hairy. This plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous颖花, which contain the seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often used in forage and erosion control due to its hardiness and adaptability. Botanically, it is a member of the Poaceae family, sharing many traits with other grasses.
